description: Each week, guests and hosts on NPR's Pop Culture Happy Hour share what's bringing them joy. This week: the show Queenie, the song "Kill The Lights," the book The Plot, and the new Knives Out teaser.
title: What's Making Us Happy: A guide to your weekend viewing, listening and reading

description: The Hulu show's brisk six episodes take us surprisingly deep inside a figure who moved constantly forward, spurred on by ambition, loneliness and a keen sense of self-protection.
title: 'Becoming Karl Lagerfeld' is the smart, dishy backstory of a style icon

description: U.S. employers added 272,000 jobs in May -- more than forecasters had expected. The unemployment rate inched up to 4% from 3.9% in April.
title: Hiring jumped in May but so did unemployment

description: Equestrian Kat Naud was on track to qualify for the Olympics when her 1500-pound horse fell on top of her. But the accident was only the beginning of a journey to manage pain that will never go away.
title: An equestrian was crushed by her horse. How she's surviving with chronic pain

description: The Post's new CEO Will Lewis tried to stop the paper from publishing a story about allegations he faces in Britain. It wasn't the first time he's attempted to head off unwanted coverage. I know, because he tried to do that to me in December.
title: 'Washington Post' publisher tried to kill a story about him. It wasn’t the first time
